intro: Cotula capensis, commonly known as African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing herb with small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has hairy, fleshy leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Cotula capensis is adapted to dry conditions and is often used in traditional medicine. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
